title.narrative: Mobilising youth to promote environmental justice in Myanmar (MFA Finland funds/ CAFOD component)

description.narrative:
This project is implemented by a consortium of 3 organizations (Caritas Finland, CAFOD and Gaia Organization) and is funded by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Finland. The design responds to the significant need of Myanmar to be able to mitigate and respond to the impact of climate change due to its high vulnerability. This caused in part by increasing deforestation, environmental degradation and an economic model promoted by the government which pursues industrialised agricultural policies over the interests of smallholders. In this regard vulnerability affects in greater part remote rural areas, primarily inhabited by minority ethnic groups and within them mostly to women, youth and other marginalised groups who have limited participation in decision making processes at local and national levels.
CAFOD will support Gaia in leading and coordinating on: start up and closing workshops, MandE processes including baseline data collection, on going monitoring and outcome harvesting workshop by the end of the project, safeguarding and research and advocacy works. All these have been agreed during the design process with the participation of the three organizations. CAFOD aims to strengthen the capacity of Gaia as an strategic partner in Myanmar and to explore new ways of working with them.
